Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student can draw a simple representation of a fish in a water environment, such as a lake or ocean.
The student may label the fish and the water environment, but labels might be inconsistent or incomplete.
The student might attempt to include some resources the fish needs, like plants, but labels might be missing or incorrect.
CANNOT: The student is likely unable to accurately label all the resources the fish needs, such as food or specific types of plants. (student may not know specific names or functions)
The student might not include other animals or plants that live in the same environment, or they might include them without labels. (student absence of connection between different organisms)
The student is unlikely to illustrate and describe how the fish and the environment work together to meet each other's needs. (student may not grasp complex environmental interactions)
